rooms.description: The entrance hall serves as a transitional space leading into an open living area with Scandinavian minimalistic design emphasizing natural light and clean lines. It features built-in storage for shoes and coats.

Located adjacent to the living area, this dining space is designed with a modern Scandinavian aesthetic that encourages communal gatherings. An integrated kitchenette provides functionality without clutter.

The open-plan kitchen features streamlined cabinetry, light color palettes and functional island seating. Vastu principles suggest positioning the kitchen in a location that allows for energy flow and avoids conflict with adjoining spaces.

The master bedroom is designed for privacy and serenity. Scandinavian design influences are evident in the use of neutral colors and natural wood finishes. Vastu guidelines have been followed by aligning the bed for optimal energy.
Two guest bedrooms maintain a balance between comfort and functionality. Minimalist Scandinavian design ensures ample storage while preserving an open feel.
A functional bathroom designed with simplicity in mind, incorporating clean lines and neutral color schemes. Placement adheres to Vastu recommendations for water usage areas.

The library features built-in bookshelves and ample seating, designed as a quiet space away from the main circulation. Scandinavian lighting ensures a calm atmosphere, while its location respects Vastu principles.

The home theater is designed as a dedicated entertainment space with integrated seating and optimal acoustics. The design utilizes Scandinavian minimalism to keep the space uncluttered while accommodating modern AV equipment.
The private gym is designed for functionality and energy. It features modern workout equipment with ample space for exercise routines, adhering to Scandinavian principles of simplicity and utility.

openings.description: A large, inviting entrance that opens directly into the living area. The design includes a vestibule to provide privacy and energy regulation.
Multiple windows ensure natural light penetration, following Vastu guidelines for health and well-being.
Interior doors are designed to facilitate smooth circulation between rooms while preserving individual privacy.

A small terrace area for relaxation and outdoor dining, ensuring connection to nature as per Scandinavian design ethos.

vastu_alignment.north: entrance and living areas should face north for positive energy.
vastu_alignment.east: kitchen ideally placed to harness morning sunlight, while ensuring smooth circulation.

notes: The design integrates Scandinavian minimalism with functional zoning and Vastu principles. Natural light, open spaces and sustainable materials are emphasized in every detail.
